edu.ucla.sspace.vector
Class CompactSparseVector

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.vector.CompactSparseVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
DoubleVector, SparseDoubleVector, SparseVector<Double>, Vector<Double>, Serializable, Iterable<DoubleEntry>
public class CompactSparseVector
extends Object
implements SparseDoubleVector, Serializable, Iterable<DoubleEntry>

A Vector instance that keeps only the non-zero values in memory, thereby saving space at the expense of time.

See SparseDoubleArray for details on how the sparse representation is implemented.

Author:
Keith Stevens
See Also:

Create a CompactSparseVector using the indices and their respecitve values.

Parameters:
indices - an sorted array of positive values representing the non-zero indices of the array
values - an array of values that correspond their respective indices
length - the total length of the array

toArray

public double[] toArray()
Returns a double array representing this vector. The returned array will be "safe" in that no changes to the array will be reflected in the vector, and likewise for changes to to the vector. The caller is thus free to modify the returned array.

Specified by:
toArray in interface DoubleVector
Returns:
a double array of this vector.
